intro: Pseudosabicea medusula, commonly known as the starry sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and distinctive, star-shaped inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Pseudosabicea medusula plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
